2#define UVW_STREAM_INCLUDE_H

5#include <algorithm>
6#include <iterator>
7#include <cstddef>
8#include <utility>
9#include <memory>
10#include <uv.h>
11#include "request.hpp"
12#include "handle.hpp"

16namespace uvw {
17
18
19/**
20 * @brief ConnectEvent event.
21 *
22 * It will be emitted by StreamHandle according with its functionalities.
23 */
24struct ConnectEvent {};
25
26
27/**
28 * @brief EndEvent event.
29 *
30 * It will be emitted by StreamHandle according with its functionalities.
31 */
32struct EndEvent {};
33
34
35/**
36 * @brief ListenEvent event.
37 *
38 * It will be emitted by StreamHandle according with its functionalities.
39 */
40struct ListenEvent {};
41
42
43/**
44 * @brief ShutdownEvent event.
45 *
46 * It will be emitted by StreamHandle according with its functionalities.
47 */
48struct ShutdownEvent {};
49
50
51/**
52 * @brief WriteEvent event.
53 *
54 * It will be emitted by StreamHandle according with its functionalities.
55 */
56struct WriteEvent {};
57
58
59/**
60 * @brief DataEvent event.
61 *
62 * It will be emitted by StreamHandle according with its functionalities.
63 */
64struct DataEvent {
65 explicit DataEvent(std::unique_ptr<char[]> buf, std::size_t len) noexcept;
66
67 std::unique_ptr<char[]> data; /*!< A bunch of data read on the stream. */
68 std::size_t length; /*!< The amount of data read on the stream. */
69};
70
71
72namespace details {
73
74
75struct ConnectReq final: public Request<ConnectReq, uv_connect_t> {
76 using Request::Request;
77
78 template<typename F, typename... Args>
79 void connect(F &&f, Args&&... args) {
80 invoke(std::forward<F>(f), get(), std::forward<Args>(args)..., &defaultCallback<ConnectEvent>);
81 }
82};
83
84
85struct ShutdownReq final: public Request<ShutdownReq, uv_shutdown_t> {
86 using Request::Request;
87
88 void shutdown(uv_stream_t *handle);
89};
90
91
92template<typename Deleter>
93class WriteReq final: public Request<WriteReq<Deleter>, uv_write_t> {
94 using ConstructorAccess = typename Request<WriteReq<Deleter>, uv_write_t>::ConstructorAccess;
95
96public:
97 WriteReq(ConstructorAccess ca, std::shared_ptr<Loop> loop, std::unique_ptr<char[], Deleter> dt, unsigned int len)
98 : Request<WriteReq<Deleter>, uv_write_t>{ca, std::move(loop)},
99 data{std::move(dt)},
100 buf{uv_buf_init(data.get(), len)}
101 {}
102
103 void write(uv_stream_t *handle) {
104 this->invoke(&uv_write, this->get(), handle, &buf, 1, &this->template defaultCallback<WriteEvent>);
105 }
106
107 void write(uv_stream_t *handle, uv_stream_t *send) {
108 this->invoke(&uv_write2, this->get(), handle, &buf, 1, send, &this->template defaultCallback<WriteEvent>);
109 }
110
111private:
112 std::unique_ptr<char[], Deleter> data;
113 uv_buf_t buf;
114};
115
116
117}
118
119
120/**
121 * @brief The StreamHandle handle.
122 *
123 * Stream handles provide an abstraction of a duplex communication channel.
124 * StreamHandle is an intermediate type, `uvw` provides three stream
125 * implementations: TCPHandle, PipeHandle and TTYHandle.
126 */
127template<typename T, typename U>
128class StreamHandle: public Handle<T, U> {
129 static constexpr unsigned int DEFAULT_BACKLOG = 128;
130
131 static void readCallback(uv_stream_t *handle, ssize_t nread, const uv_buf_t *buf) {
132 T &ref = *(static_cast<T*>(handle->data));
133 // data will be destroyed no matter of what the value of nread is
134 std::unique_ptr<char[]> data{buf->base};
135
136 // nread == 0 is ignored (see http://docs.libuv.org/en/v1.x/stream.html)
137 // equivalent to EAGAIN/EWOULDBLOCK, it shouldn't be treated as an error
138 // for we don't have data to emit though, it's fine to suppress it
139
140 if(nread == UV_EOF) {
141 // end of stream
142 ref.publish(EndEvent{});
143 } else if(nread > 0) {
144 // data available
145 ref.publish(DataEvent{std::move(data), static_cast<std::size_t>(nread)});
146 } else if(nread < 0) {
147 // transmission error
148 ref.publish(ErrorEvent(nread));
149 }
150 }
151
152 static void listenCallback(uv_stream_t *handle, int status) {
153 T &ref = *(static_cast<T*>(handle->data));
154 if(status) { ref.publish(ErrorEvent{status}); }
155 else { ref.publish(ListenEvent{}); }
156 }
157
158public:
159#ifdef _MSC_VER
160 StreamHandle(typename Handle<T, U>::ConstructorAccess ca, std::shared_ptr<Loop> ref)
161 : Handle<T, U>{ca, std::move(ref)}
162 {}
163#else
164 using Handle<T, U>::Handle;
165#endif
166
167 /**
168 * @brief Shutdowns the outgoing (write) side of a duplex stream.
169 *
170 * It waits for pending write requests to complete. The handle should refer
171 * to a initialized stream.<br/>
172 * A ShutdownEvent event will be emitted after shutdown is complete.
173 */
174 void shutdown() {
175 auto listener = [ptr = this->shared_from_this()](const auto &event, const auto &) {
176 ptr->publish(event);
177 };
178
179 auto shutdown = this->loop().template resource<details::ShutdownReq>();
180 shutdown->template once<ErrorEvent>(listener);
181 shutdown->template once<ShutdownEvent>(listener);
182 shutdown->shutdown(this->template get<uv_stream_t>());
183 }
184
185 /**
186 * @brief Starts listening for incoming connections.
187 *
188 * When a new incoming connection is received, a ListenEvent event is
189 * emitted.<br/>
190 * An ErrorEvent event will be emitted in case of errors.
191 *
192 * @param backlog Indicates the number of connections the kernel might
193 * queue, same as listen(2).
194 */
195 void listen(int backlog = DEFAULT_BACKLOG) {
196 this->invoke(&uv_listen, this->template get<uv_stream_t>(), backlog, &listenCallback);
197 }
198
199 /**
200 * @brief Accepts incoming connections.
201 *
202 * This call is used in conjunction with `listen()` to accept incoming
203 * connections. Call this function after receiving a ListenEvent event to
204 * accept the connection. Before calling this function, the submitted handle
205 * must be initialized.<br>
206 * An ErrorEvent event will be emitted in case of errors.
207 *
208 * When the ListenEvent event is emitted it is guaranteed that this
209 * function will complete successfully the first time. If you attempt to use
210 * it more than once, it may fail.<br/>
211 * It is suggested to only call this function once per ListenEvent event.
212 *
213 * @note
214 * Both the handles must be running on the same loop.
215 *
216 * @param ref An initialized handle to be used to accept the connection.
217 */
218 template<typename S>
219 void accept(S &ref) {
220 this->invoke(&uv_accept, this->template get<uv_stream_t>(), this->template get<uv_stream_t>(ref));
221 }
222
223 /**
224 * @brief Starts reading data from an incoming stream.
225 *
226 * A DataEvent event will be emitted several times until there is no more
227 * data to read or `stop()` is called.<br/>
228 * An EndEvent event will be emitted when there is no more data to read.
229 */
230 void read() {
231 this->invoke(&uv_read_start, this->template get<uv_stream_t>(), &this->allocCallback, &readCallback);
232 }
233
234 /**
235 * @brief Stops reading data from the stream.
236 *
237 * This function is idempotent and may be safely called on a stopped stream.
238 */
239 void stop() {
240 this->invoke(&uv_read_stop, this->template get<uv_stream_t>());
241 }
242
243 /**
244 * @brief Writes data to the stream.
245 *
246 * Data are written in order. The handle takes the ownership of the data and
247 * it is in charge of delete them.
248 *
249 * A WriteEvent event will be emitted when the data have been written.<br/>
250 * An ErrorEvent event will be emitted in case of errors.
251 *
252 * @param data The data to be written to the stream.
253 * @param len The lenght of the submitted data.
254 */
255 template<typename Deleter>
256 void write(std::unique_ptr<char[], Deleter> data, unsigned int len) {
257 auto req = this->loop().template resource<details::WriteReq<Deleter>>(std::move(data), len);
258 auto listener = [ptr = this->shared_from_this()](const auto &event, const auto &) {
259 ptr->publish(event);
260 };
261
262 req->template once<ErrorEvent>(listener);
263 req->template once<WriteEvent>(listener);
264 req->write(this->template get<uv_stream_t>());
265 }
266
267 /**
268 * @brief Writes data to the stream.
269 *
270 * Data are written in order. The handle doesn't take the ownership of the
271 * data. Be sure that their lifetime overcome the one of the request.
272 *
273 * A WriteEvent event will be emitted when the data have been written.<br/>
274 * An ErrorEvent event will be emitted in case of errors.
275 *
276 * @param data The data to be written to the stream.
277 * @param len The lenght of the submitted data.
278 */
279 void write(char *data, unsigned int len) {
280 auto req = this->loop().template resource<details::WriteReq<void(*)(char *)>>(std::unique_ptr<char[], void(*)(char *)>{data, [](char *) {}}, len);
281 auto listener = [ptr = this->shared_from_this()](const auto &event, const auto &) {
282 ptr->publish(event);
283 };
284
285 req->template once<ErrorEvent>(listener);
286 req->template once<WriteEvent>(listener);
287 req->write(this->template get<uv_stream_t>());
288 }
289
290 /**
291 * @brief Extended write function for sending handles over a pipe handle.
292 *
293 * The pipe must be initialized with `ipc == true`.
294 *
295 * `send` must be a TCPHandle or PipeHandle handle, which is a server or a
296 * connection (listening or connected state). Bound sockets or pipes will be
297 * assumed to be servers.
298 *
299 * The handle takes the ownership of the data and it is in charge of delete
300 * them.
301 *
302 * A WriteEvent event will be emitted when the data have been written.<br/>
303 * An ErrorEvent wvent will be emitted in case of errors.
304 *
305 * @param send The handle over which to write data.
306 * @param data The data to be written to the stream.
307 * @param len The lenght of the submitted data.
308 */
309 template<typename S, typename Deleter>
310 void write(S &send, std::unique_ptr<char[], Deleter> data, unsigned int len) {
311 auto req = this->loop().template resource<details::WriteReq<Deleter>>(std::move(data), len);
312 auto listener = [ptr = this->shared_from_this()](const auto &event, const auto &) {
313 ptr->publish(event);
314 };
315
316 req->template once<ErrorEvent>(listener);
317 req->template once<WriteEvent>(listener);
318 req->write(this->template get<uv_stream_t>(), this->template get<uv_stream_t>(send));
319 }
320
321 /**
322 * @brief Extended write function for sending handles over a pipe handle.
323 *
324 * The pipe must be initialized with `ipc == true`.
325 *
326 * `send` must be a TCPHandle or PipeHandle handle, which is a server or a
327 * connection (listening or connected state). Bound sockets or pipes will be
328 * assumed to be servers.
329 *
330 * The handle doesn't take the ownership of the data. Be sure that their
331 * lifetime overcome the one of the request.
332 *
333 * A WriteEvent event will be emitted when the data have been written.<br/>
334 * An ErrorEvent wvent will be emitted in case of errors.
335 *
336 * @param send The handle over which to write data.
337 * @param data The data to be written to the stream.
338 * @param len The lenght of the submitted data.
339 */
340 template<typename S>
341 void write(S &send, char *data, unsigned int len) {
342 auto req = this->loop().template resource<details::WriteReq<void(*)(char *)>>(std::unique_ptr<char[], void(*)(char *)>{data, [](char *) {}}, len);
343 auto listener = [ptr = this->shared_from_this()](const auto &event, const auto &) {
344 ptr->publish(event);
345 };
346
347 req->template once<ErrorEvent>(listener);
348 req->template once<WriteEvent>(listener);
349 req->write(this->template get<uv_stream_t>(), this->template get<uv_stream_t>(send));
350 }
351
352 /**
353 * @brief Queues a write request if it can be completed immediately.
354 *
355 * Same as `write()`, but wont queue a write request if it cant be
356 * completed immediately.<br/>
357 * An ErrorEvent event will be emitted in case of errors.
358 *
359 * @param data The data to be written to the stream.
360 * @param len The lenght of the submitted data.
361 * @return Number of bytes written.
362 */
363 int tryWrite(std::unique_ptr<char[]> data, unsigned int len) {
364 uv_buf_t bufs[] = { uv_buf_init(data.get(), len) };
365 auto bw = uv_try_write(this->template get<uv_stream_t>(), bufs, 1);
366
367 if(bw < 0) {
368 this->publish(ErrorEvent{bw});
369 bw = 0;
370 }
371
372 return bw;
373 }
374
375 /**
376 * @brief Queues a write request if it can be completed immediately.
377 *
378 * Same as `write()`, but wont queue a write request if it cant be
379 * completed immediately.<br/>
380 * An ErrorEvent event will be emitted in case of errors.
381 *
382 * @param data The data to be written to the stream.
383 * @param len The lenght of the submitted data.
384 * @return Number of bytes written.
385 */
386 int tryWrite(char *data, unsigned int len) {
387 uv_buf_t bufs[] = { uv_buf_init(data, len) };
388 auto bw = uv_try_write(this->template get<uv_stream_t>(), bufs, 1);
389
390 if(bw < 0) {
391 this->publish(ErrorEvent{bw});
392 bw = 0;
393 }
394
395 return bw;
396 }
397
398 /**
399 * @brief Checks if the stream is readable.
400 * @return True if the stream is readable, false otherwise.
401 */
402 bool readable() const noexcept {
403 return (uv_is_readable(this->template get<uv_stream_t>()) == 1);
404 }
405
406 /**
407 * @brief Checks if the stream is writable.
408 * @return True if the stream is writable, false otherwise.
409 */
410 bool writable() const noexcept {
411 return (uv_is_writable(this->template get<uv_stream_t>()) == 1);
412 }
413
414 /**
415 * @brief Enables or disables blocking mode for a stream.
416 *
417 * When blocking mode is enabled all writes complete synchronously. The
418 * interface remains unchanged otherwise, e.g. completion or failure of the
419 * operation will still be reported through events which are emitted
420 * asynchronously.
421 *
422 * See the official
423 * [documentation](http://docs.libuv.org/en/v1.x/stream.html#c.uv_stream_set_blocking)
424 * for further details.
425 *
426 * @param enable True to enable blocking mode, false otherwise.
427 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
428 */
429 bool blocking(bool enable = false) {
430 return (0 == uv_stream_set_blocking(this->template get<uv_stream_t>(), enable));
431 }
432
433 /**
434 * @brief Gets the amount of queued bytes waiting to be sent.
435 * @return Amount of queued bytes waiting to be sent.
436 */
437 size_t writeQueueSize() const noexcept {
438 return uv_stream_get_write_queue_size(this->template get<uv_stream_t>());
439 }
440};
441
442
443}
444

448#endif

450#endif // UVW_STREAM_INCLUDE_H
